#summary Links to useful datasheets.
#labels Featured

Below are categorized links to useful component datasheets related to the OpenDSO project:

=ADC (Analog to Digital Converters)=
 * *Analog Devices [http://www.analog.com/static/imported-files/Data_Sheets/AD9288.pdf AD9288]*: 8-Bit, 40/80/100 MSPS Dual A/D Converter
 * *Analog Devices [http://www.analog.com/static/imported-files/data_sheets/AD9283.pdf AD9283]*: 8-Bit, 50 MSPS/80 MSPS/100 MSPS 3 V A/D Converter
 * *Maxim [http://datasheets.maxim-ic.com/en/ds/MAX1180.pdf MAX1180]*: Dual 10-Bit, 105Msps, 3.3V, Low-Power ADC with Internal Reference and Parallel Outputs
 * *Maxim [http://datasheets.maxim-ic.com/en/ds/MAX19506.pdf MAX19506]*: Dual-Channel, 8-Bit, 100Msps ADC
 * *National Semiconductor [http://www.national.com/ds/AD/ADC08100.pdf ADC08100]/[http://www.national.com/ds/AD/ADC08200.pdf ADC08200]*: 8-Bit, 20 Msps to 100/200 Msps, Low Power A/D Converter with Internal Sample-and-Hold
 * *Texas Instruments [http://focus.ti.com/lit/ds/symlink/ads831.pdf ADS831]*: 8-Bit, 80MHz Sampling Analog-to-Digital Converter

=Clock oscillators=
 * *ECS [http://www.ecsxtal.com/store/pdf/ecs-3951m-bn-3953m-bn.pdf 3951M]*: ± 50 ppm SMD Clock Oscillator
